thread.title: MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy hopes for a better show at Ghala Open
thread.title_full: MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy hopes for a better show at Ghala Open

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy hopes for a better show at Ghala Open
text:
MENA Golf Tour: Azaan al Rumhy hopes for a better show at Ghala Open Azaan al Rumhy, Oman’s top-ranked golfer Muscat Daily staff writer October 26, 2015 
Oman's top-ranked golfer Azaan al Rumhy will look to benefit from playing in his own backyard when the MENA Golf Tour makes the ninth stopover of the 11-leg series at Ghala Golf Club, starting on Monday. 
Azaan, who lives just a lob wedge away from the course, will be joined by two of his national teammates, Ali Hameed and Rashad al Harthy, in leading the home challenge against a quality international field in the Ghala Open, led by defending champion Zane Scotland of England. 
Fresh from competing in the Nomura Cup in Abu Dhabi, UAE, the trio will look to come up with a good performance in the MENA division that recognises the region’s top performers, creating a separate competition within the main competition. 
“I know the course pretty well, having played on it numerous times. If I play to my potential, I think I can do well here. The immediate goal is to try and make the cut and then see how far I can go,” said Azaan. 
“Whatever the outcome, playing alongside a strong field will be a great learning curve.” 
Azaan had missed the cut at the Muscat Hills Championship, the eighth stop over of the MENA Tour, last week. 
If Azaan and his fellow Omanis have their own goals, England’s Scotland, a nine-time winner on the tour, will be eyeing another strong finish, if not victory, to close the gap on his compatriot Gary King, who currently leads the Order of Merit standings. 
With just one more event left on the 2015 MENA Golf Tour schedule before the cut is made for the season-ending Tour Championship, the third edition of the tournament at Ghala will keep things interesting with players jockeying for positions on the Order of Merit. 
Also, an interesting battle for the honours in the amateur division is brewing with India’s Rayhan Thomas and Morocco’s Ayoub Lguirati, who finished tied on top at Muscat Hills last week, fast catching up with leader James Allan of England. 
With Morocco’s Younes El Hassani returning to form with a tied fourth at Muscat Hills, the title race in the MENA division has been thrown open. Just US$3,000 separates the top four, including frontrunner Faycal Serghini, indicating the race for the Shaikh Maktoum Golf Foundation has all the ingredients for a thrilling finish.
